comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Could be en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Henry_Dietz Photo looks a possible match. He played football for the Carlisle Industrial School, but there seems to have been some controversy over whether he was really an American Indian. He was known as Lone Star Dietz. From Wikipedia, "In spring 1933, George Preston Marshall, owner of the Boston Braves, hired Dietz to replace Coach Lud Wray. Marshall then came up with a new name: the “Boston Redskins.” In 1937, the team moved to Washington, D.C."

comment._content: Another photo of Dietz
